page.title: 05Landscape North of the River
page.content: The ruins of Calwich Abbey stand in the wooded area across the river from Norbury. There is a lake in front of them with an 18th century rotunda at one end. The ground rises above Calwich to run in an undulating ridge, 600 foot at its highest to Middle Mayfield. At the N.W. corner of the area the lake drops into a deep valley with Dasley Wood on one side and Dydon on the other. From Church Mayfield the Dove loops its way to Norbury, its flow broken by three weirs. The disused railway runs along the valley and its two bridges over the river have been dismantled. The river which is the county boundary marks the gradual change to dry stone walls for fencing and domestic building.
